title: Can I Get Some Context for the Poppy Nerfs on the PBE?

embed.description: EXTREMELY WIP! ] [STATUS: PBE is currently offline.] The PBE has been updated! As we start the 8.9 PBE cycle, today's patch includes a new skin for Evelynn, new chroma for Mecha Zero Sion, and much more! Continue reading for more information!

body:
Poppy is more or less being nerfed across the board on the PBE right now. Considering she's already a pretty weak champion in solo queue I'm curious what the context behind Riot's decision here is. 

Is this a "muh Worlds" thing?

replies.body:
ult doesn't make you untargeable anymore which is massive
E range increased

the changes are a buff for competitive play and neutral for soloq
You're only targetable during it if it's uncharged. So it's just a normal, single-target .75 second knock-up on a 140 second CD. That's not massive.

> [{quoted}](name=Attticus Finch,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=FxVevYWJ,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-04-17T21:58:25.677+0000)

ok fam

{{champion:12}}  literally does that a 100 times better, with better AoE knock-up hitbox & shorter cooldown.

Hell, even {{champion:54}} 's ult is 1000x better than Poppy's.
But the point is that her uncharged ult won't fuck up other people's burst patterns anymore.

I agree it's better clarity for synergised combo, but making the target Untargetable for the first 0.75sec was far off from the reason of why she isn't a popular pick in competitive plays compared to the last 2 years.

Yes it *kind of* is.

She was good in competitive the first time because she had high early damage for a tank, which was given *because* her cc has so many conditions. Riot shaved the damage all over, and cut her E range, to bring her in line, causing an overnerf in comparison to other tanks. They then tried buffing her in these little ways that didn't directly add damage, primarily her W, but that didn't work that well, either.

The reason she was so tough at first was because her cc is very conditional. People don't like her beating face so hard, so the next thing to do is to make her cc less conditional so she doesn't have to hit like a truck to be a justified pick.

alistar is played top?

lol ok
I thought we're comparing the quality & impact of knockups between certain champions.

It actually is though, as a person that's played a fair amount of Poppy. If you R, like an assassin currently, that engaged on your adc, you have to insta E them afterwards after the untargetability, expending all your of direct hard cc on a single target that most likely won't kill them (and if you didn't have it, all it meant was the assassin would disengage/ complete the kill), and now with this change, ulting an assassin will mean that the assassin dies before they hit the ground. Which means your adc lives. Which means you win the teamfight. Which means you win whatever objective/the game.

It also lets her play as an engage tank since it means that doing E->R actually has follow up since the enemies not being untargetable means your teammates can actually land cc skillshots on them as follow up instead of being too afraid to because the untargetability can easily waste their important cooldowns.

Right now, poppy's ult is used positively for like 2 reasons:
1.you are getting ganked so you channel it and knock who ever's "catching" you away  from you before they can apply cc/kill you.
2.during a messy team fight you break out near the beginning cc storm/mosh pit and ult an important carry away. If your ult hits a tank, you've wasted it and there's a fair chance you lose. If you ulted the Orianna, then you probably won that teamfight. This play is extremely risky to do by the way since you need to spend 1-2 seconds channeling that could've easily been disrupted/bodyblocked in that cc moshpit and therefore been wasted (and have no effect beyond expending an enemy cd).

It also just makes here way easier for new players since Poppy's ult as a whole in it's current state is REALLY PUNISHING IN THE WRONG HANDS. The untargetability and required target selection can easily throw fights. Hitting a tank doesn't do anything beyond give their frontline invuln, while the enemy backline pelts you for free damage; you are NOT going to move forward because the untargetability is short enough that moving your team forward would get them grossly mispositioned and killed. A more common scenario that will happen in soloQ, is an assassin jumps on your carries and you channel your ult and then use it on an assassin, and if you are too slow (aka you used your ult reactively), then you lose that fight because the assassin most likely killed your carry within the channel time and then they got a get-out-of-jail free card from your ult. With this change, all that's required is E->R on the shaco and you can maybe win.
She's still going to be one of the most difficult new player champs one could pick because of the nature of her W requiring extreme amounts of game knowledge surrounding what dashes you can block (a common new player match up, master yi for example you cannot block, nor can your W do anything against garen), knowing _when_ your opponent would dash in the context of a fight (xin zhao vs lee sin vs renekton dashes are quite different in when they dash) and also just having the reflexes/anticipation to use it at the opportune time or otherwise it being a dead skill.

edit:also forgot to mention that it means hitting level 6 gives you an actual power spike now in the 1 vs 1. Her ult is deadpan useless in a 1 vs 1 (beyond running away), the untargetability doesn't help you win the fight at all, it merely delays it for some very negligible amounts of damage. being able to throw in an auto on a knocked up target (or _gasp_ have your Q trigger it's 2nd dmg instance during the ult) actually helps her a lot.

I agree with these changes as well because like most people here have said, it makes her CC less situational. My only complaint is how much armor/mr she is losing in order to justify these nerfs, not necessarily the kind of nerf. Maybe it's for the best.
